alert.note: Alert for Dickinson; Osceola (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Sioux Falls (Southeastern SD, Southwestern MN, and Northwestern IA)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued May 29 at 5:21AM CDT until May 29 at 6:15AM CDT by NWS Sioux Falls
info.description: The National Weather Service in Sioux Falls has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Northeastern Osceola County in northwestern Iowa... Northern Dickinson County in northwestern Iowa... Jackson County in southwestern Minnesota... Eastern Nobles County in southwestern Minnesota... Eastern Murray County in southwestern Minnesota... Cottonwood County in southwestern Minnesota... * Until 615 AM CDT. * At 520 AM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from Currie to near Fulda to near Sibley, moving northeast at 50 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts and half dollar size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect considerable tree damage. Wind damage is also likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. * Severe thunderstorms will be near... Brewster, Currie and Dovray around 525 AM CDT. Westbrook around 530 AM CDT. Heron Lake and Storden around 535 AM CDT. Other locations in the path of these severe thunderstorms include Windom, Lake Park, Jeffers, Bergen, Spirit Lake, Orleans, Bingham Lake, Mountain Lake, Lakefield and Superior. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.25 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
